column4: If i change root password, will it ask for password when i log in recovery mode?
As i remember ,recovery mode doesnt ask for password for login
yes, i believe it will nowadays.
recovery mode is just single-user mode (runlevel 1). everything is available to you, but not all services are running by default.
i think ChatWatch is confused. best just to let it go, i think.
ok but is that a bot?
vikas:now that is strange behaviour isnt it? are you sure you are  saving settings in bios?
he says,in case a customer cant boot windows,they insert sd card ,then grub auto boots from that device
will take much more than taht to install it
doesn't on the machines at my facility.
yeah u mean it takes more time?
hmm so what is the time taken at your facility
i just mentioned it. is there a point to this conversation?
yes, do you have any average time it takes to install to a 'modern' machine>?

if you have an opinion, please state it. but not to me, as i am not particularly interested. the man asked if his install went too quickly. without evidence to the contrary, i don't see any reason to be overly concerned on this point.
